Uses of Package
obr

Classes in obr used by obr
Atom
          Represents an atom.
Note that instances of this class can be returned by the atom conjunction class, but this will imply the atom creation.
AtomConjunction
          Represents a conjunction of atoms.
AtomConjunction.AtomIterator
          Iterator over the atoms of the conjunction.
Since atoms are not stored into the internal structure, the remove operation is not supported.
AtomConjunction.NeighbourIterator
          Iterator over the vertices connected to a specific one.
AtomicRule
          Represents an atomic rule.
A rule is an atom conjunction which adds the notions of "body" and "head".
An atomic rule contains only one atom in its head.
DecidableClassCheck
          Interface for functions checking if a graph of rule dependencies or a subset of this graph belongs to a concrete decidable class.
DecidableClassLabel
          Label for a decidable class check.
ExtensionFailureException
          Exception thrown by the extension algorithm if failure.
GraphPositionDependencies
          Represents the graph of position dependencies corresponding to a GRD or to one of its strongly connected components.
The graph maintains a hash map to find quickly the vertex corresponding to a predicate and its position.
GraphRuleDependencies
          Unsecure : if a vertex already in the graph is added once again, it may produce strange behaviour if an edge is added manually it may produce errors
GRDAnalyser.AbstractClassChecker
           
GRDAnalyser.ClassChecker
           
GRDAnalyser.DecidableClassChecker
           
MarkFailureException
          Exception thrown by the marking process of some concrete class checks when it fails.
Predicate
          Represents a predicate with its label and its arity.
RuleIdentityFunction
           
StickyCheck
          Checks if a set of rules satisfies the stickiness property.
Term
          A term may be either a variable or a constant.
A constant is surround by simple quotes.
UnrecognizedStringFormatException
          Exception thrown whenever a string is not recognized.
